titlStmt.titl: Supplementary Data for Evaluating How Landform Design and Soil Covers Influence Groundwater Recharge in a Reclaimed Watershed

citation.biblCit: Lukenbach, Maxwell, 2019, "Supplementary Data for Evaluating How Landform Design and Soil Covers Influence Groundwater Recharge in a Reclaimed Watershed", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/9WIVXW, UAL Dataverse, V1, UNF:6:nM1Boq9+7E7aDAOYnr/zvA== [fileUNF]

titlStmt.titl: Supplementary Data for Evaluating How Landform Design and Soil Covers Influence Groundwater Recharge in a Reclaimed Watershed

stdyInfo.abstract: This data can be used to recreate figures and replicate modelling and analyses conducted in relation to the publication. (2018-10-19)
stdyInfo.notes: ---Soil and hydrogeological characteristics are provided in Table 1 of the main text ---The HYDRUS software packaged was used, and the uploaded files can be used to recreate the models detailed in the publication ---The model domain is detailed in Figure 2 of the main text ---Long-term simulations are based on inputs from Carrera-Hernandez et al., 2012 (see main text for citation) ---For annual wetland evapotranspiration comparison values, see Nichols et al., 2016 (see main text for citation)

citation.biblCit: Lukenbach, M. C., Spencer, C. J., Mendoza, C. A., Devito, K. J., Landh√§usser, S. M., & Carey, S. K. ( 2019). Evaluating how landform design and soil covers influence groundwater recharge in a reclaimed watershed. Water Resources Research, 55. https://doi.org/10.1029/2018WR024298
